thread.title: Egypt seeks LE360bn private sector infrastructure investments this year: Minister - Economy - Business
thread.title_full: Egypt seeks LE360bn private sector infrastructure investments this year: Minister - Economy - Business - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Egypt seeks LE360bn private sector infrastructure investments this year: Minister - Economy - Business
text:
Related Egypt pound weakens in central bank sale, parallel market Egypt to launch administrative capital, north coast city projects at end of October Egypt will need LE360 billion ($45.4 billion) in private sector investments in infrastructure projects in the 2015/2016 fiscal year, Minister of Investment Ashraf Salman said on Monday.
To reach its target growth rate of 5 to 5.5 percent of GDP, Egypt will need a total of LE420 billion ($53 billion) in investments, of which the government can only provide LE60 billion, said Salman, speaking at the third annual PPP Investment Summit Egypt in Cairo.
